definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: How meaningful are your likes and what are the impacts of your dislikes?
sentences.chinese: 你的喜恶分别有多重要的影响？

sentences.english: As you know, ma'am, different nations have different preferences and abhorrences.
sentences.chinese: 女士，您知道吧，不同的民族有不同的喜恶。

sentences.english: You need to know the likes and dislikes of your partner.
sentences.chinese: 你需要知道的喜恶，你的合作伙伴。

sentences.english: Influence comes in many forms we don't have to like it to recognise it.
sentences.chinese: 影响力有很多形式，不以他人的喜恶为转移。

sentences.english: In the history, Asian mainly kill human for fun and anger.
sentences.chinese: 历史上，很多亚洲人因喜恶来互相杀戮，并以此为乐。

sentences.english: Laura is a very passionate person who has strong likes and dislikes .
sentences.chinese: 萝拉是个非常热情的人，拥有强烈的喜恶。

definition: to like/fond of/to prefer/to love/one's tastes/preference
four types of human emotions, namely: happiness 歡喜|欢喜[huan1 xi3], anger 憤怒|愤怒[fen4 nu4], sorrow 悲哀[bei1 ai1] and joy 快樂|快乐[kuai4 le4]
to appraise/to pass judgment on/to speak ill of/praise and censure/appraisal
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
words and actions/what one says and what one does
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
